Oh this game is best. Nothing can beat whole Bioshock Franchise. Clearly unique and awesome gameplay and Enviroment. This Game is fav of all 3 games. I can write an whole book about this game. I donno where to begin so
1. I love Eliza she is cuteğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚ and Booker's Attitude a total bad ass character.
2. Story plot just real good man. End of this game might twist your mind. if u had played bioshock 1 only 
    then u can understand the ending of biohsock infinite how one thing link to another just so awesome. 
3. Gameplay smooth+Unique 
4. A city in sky and how they made it as realastic as possible is sure something to appricate about.
5. Some real good enemy can be found as well.
6. Side character chit-chat is worth listening some times ğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚

There are more but i am lazy to type and think hard ğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚so these are my reasons to play bioshock search yours. ğŸ˜‰
Great Game makes me wish there was an option to free roam.

Wow! This game was an amazing experience from start to finish
Story wise, it was captivating and interesting, got me hooked all the way to the end! very consistent.
Gameplay is great, so much fun experimenting with different guns or just meleeing enemies like crazy.
World design was incredibly immersive! The first moment in Columbia was jaw dropping.


In conclusion, this game is a gem! Definitely a recommend. People who havent tried this game is missing out on a wonderful, emotional experience!
amazing game always a hell of a time to play through it
Incredible game. Much better than I was led to believe.

I'm really enjoying this game. great game-play, great story. my only complain is Graphics issue, The render distance. 

I don't know if it's a bug, but every now and then, the textures on some objects(doors, furnitures, advertising poster etc...) are very blurry in just >2 meters away, and when I get pretty close to it(<=1 meter), then the hq texture renders in, but gets blurry again if I take a little distance again. Which is a bit annoying... I have set all the graphic options to ultra. I'm playing the game on a msi gaming laptop, with a rtx 2060 6gb, i7 9th gen, 24gb ram, Linux Mint. And my laptop has no problem with overheating or power-charge or anything like that. Maybe is because I'm playing it on Linux, that this OS wasn't well optimised for this game. 

This is the only complain I have, other than that. This Game is awesome!

Bioshock infinite is a game that launched in 2013. Now 7 later, the graphics have not aged much and the world is a stunning masterpiece. Unlike it's predecessors, you see the buildings you are going into, giving you this feel that you are wondering in a city above the earth. 

The plot is incredible and the ending will leave you speechless. I found myself wanting to explore Columbia more than most modern games. This is easily a must play of any game of the series. 

There a few issues I had with the game however. Sound was one of them. And the fact that I had to do a little bit of extra work to get the fonts and icons to display correctly did not rub me right. Still it was worth it and it was not difficult at all to fix. There is a guide on here in steam on how to do it. 

The few things I didn't like about the game were small things like not having legs, no reflections in mirrors. But those are minor things. This game was worth every penny.

[hr][/hr] 

First thing I have to say about Infinite is that it gave me motion sickness as soon as I started playing it. Pretty bad, to the extent that I almost puked the first time. Bioshock 1 and 2 didn't do this. I went to the files to fix the following:

C:\Users\yourname*\OneDrive\Documents\My Games\BioShock Infinite\XGame\Config

go in there and find the following:
[code]DefaultbReduceMotionSickness=1[/code]
[code]bReduceMotionSickness=True[/code] (I have to say that this setting kept changing automatically to False so I was never really able to change this)
[code]MaxUserFOVOffsetPercent=90.000000[/code]

with all this done, I think the only TRUE thing that helped was the last line of code that changed the FOV to 90 and I was able to adjust the FOV slider in the options menu a lot better. Now, the BEST thing that helped the motion sickness was to stop running in the game. When you run it has a head bobbin movement that is truly horrible and there is no way of turning that off, thanks developers, so I just stopped running altogether. I literally walked everywhere in this game like a nerd. Elizabeth wanted me to hurry up,... nope, you're going to have to wait for my slow ass to get there.
[hr][/hr] 

Now let's get into the actual game.

I am a fan of the first two games. I absolutely love them. This was the perfect continuation to the series. It's a story rich game that it's so fast paced that you know you're missing things as you play along. important plots are being missed cause of the euphoria you feel at the moment because you just got jumped by like 10 guys and are out of ammo and have to get that while at the same time listening to the story. I'm used to that from playing the first two games so I was expecting it. Regardless of the quick pace, the game is marvelous. I absolutely loved this game. It can also be played as a â€œstand aloneâ€ FPS if you haven't played the first two, just don't play the DLC's Burial at Sea until you play 1 and 2.

As a continuation of the story, it really doesn't tie well UNTIL you play the DLC's Burial at Sea. My god, what a story that is. I have no idea why those are DLC's, they should've been a mandatory continuation after playing Infinite. Those DLC's hold the key to tying the stories from Bioshock 1 and Infinite and they made that in such a superb way that is just a masterpiece. It's an incredibly story rich game with many ways of interpreting it. I truly recommend playing 1,2, Infinite and then the DLC's to fully tie all the loose ends. Watch YouTube videos if you need a better explanation of the events.

Let me start off by saying that I don't really like the whole steampunk aesthetic. I don't think you can really mix the past and the future together very well. While I still stand by this, the colonial-themed future idea is kind of cool.  I think this is an interesting take on an alternate history where we figured out how to make entire cities float using quantum science. The game itself is a lot of fun to play, and the story is definitely interesting.

  Graphically, very unimpressive by today's standards. But it was 2013 when this came out, so I can't say much about that. Also, quick little note on Elizabeth: Why she built like that? Like jesus she has no midriff. Her figure reminds me of ReeKid saying "You're not dummy thicc, you're dummy stick." And if you add that plus her big eyes, she ends up looking like a 1900s Alita Battle Angel. Not a complaint, I just thought maybe I could get some jokes in. But for real, that is a slender woman. 

Gameplay is pretty good, but the controls are low key garbage. Yeah, standard WASD keys for moving, and shooting is left mouse, but the melee button is a bit of a ways off from the main key area (V key). I haven't actually tried to change the key configurations yet cause I've been so lost in the actual game. But I think better defaults should have been Q to change weapons, E as a function key, right mouse to aim, and middle mouse to use Vigors. I would use mouse five as my melee button, but if you don't have an epic gamer mouse, figure something else out or go buy one. The arsenal isn't anything super huge, like COD, but its also not small, like in SUPERHOT. Its got a mid size arsenal, but regardless of size there's a weapon for everyone: A pistol, a revolver, a couple automatic weapons, a sniper rifle, a marksman rifle, a shotgun, and some heavy weaponry like RPGs. 

The story is pretty cool. Its got kind of a scientific yet supernatural vibe to it. The idea with Elizabeth is that she can open portals, or "tears" as she calls them, which can bring you to a parallel universe or bring something onto the battlefield, like a spot to grapple onto or an automated turret. So her "Dad," the prophet Comstock, thought that was scary so he and his wife locked Elizabeth up in a tower, and now you have to rescue her to pay back some kind of debt to some loan sharks (I guess?).

I really like this game. Its definitely a good buy for FPS fans, and especially steampunk fans. I got it on sale for a little over 7 bucks, and I've gotten 6 hours of gameplay as of the time writing this review. I don't like spending a lot of money on games, so whether or not you should sacrifice like 30 bucks for this is up to you, cause I can't say. 4/5 stars, very happy with this!

Edit: Finished the game a couple hours ago. That was just under 7 hours of gameplay, and there's not multiplayer. Definitely not worth 30 bucks, get it on sale. Still good tho!

Incredible addition to the Bioshock games, I'd reccomend playing the first one before this one as it will make the experience better. The controls are super smooth, the gameplay is totally unique and really well made, And the story while convoluted at times was really solid. The few complaints I have are : No Big Daddies in this game, Weapon upgrades feel way less impactful than the first one, and a lot of the vigors I never found myself using. Overall even with those small details easy 10/10
